query.description: The redirect uri should be the exact same as what was provided at the time of app creation
This will be sent back to you in the redirect URL
This will be included in the id_token which is received at the end of step 2

request.description:
## Step 1

You need to redirect the user to the login page with all the necessary query parameters.

## Step 2

- code
    - You will be required to take the authentication code received in the first request and send it to the backend server in this request. 

- appIdHash
    - This needs to be created at your end with the application id and the secret key
    - You will need to send the SHA256 hash of appId:secretKey
    - Eg: appId = abcd1234-100 and secretKey = qwerty6789
    - Create a string variable abcd1234-100:qwerty6789
    - Create a SHA256 hash of the newly created string
    - You can use this only tool to create a SHA256 string while testing:  https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/sha256.html

query.description: The redirect uri should be the exact same as what was provided at the time of app creation
This is a SHA256 hash of the code_verifier which you have created at your end
This will be sent back to you in the redirect URL
This will be included in the id_token which is received at the end of step 2

request.description:
# Step 1
The PKCE flow is used for Single Page Application (SPA) / Mobile Apps wherein storing the secret key is unsafe. For such applications. 

## Parameters
- You will be required to create a random string within your front end application called code_verifier
- The code_challenge is the SHA256 hash of the code_verifier. 
    - You can use this only tool to create a SHA256 string while testing: https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/sha256.html
- You will also be required to create a unique string within your front end application called nonce. You will receive the nonce in the id_token at the end of step 2

## Step 2
- code - This is the Authrorization code which is received in step 1
- code_verifier - This is the random string which was created in step 1

query.description: The redirect uri should be the exact same as what was provided at the time of app creation
This will be sent back to you in the redirect URL

request.description:
# Step 1
The PKCE flow is used for Single Page Application (SPA) / Mobile Apps wherein storing the secret key is unsafe. For such applications. 

## Parameters
- You will be required to create a random string within your front end application called code_verifier
- The code_challenge is the SHA256 hash of the code_verifier. 
    - You can use this only tool to create a SHA256 string while testing: https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/sha256.html
- You will also be required to create a unique string within your front end application called nonce. You will receive the nonce in the id_token at the end of step 2

## Step 2
- code - This is the Authrorization code which is received in step 1
- code_verifier - This is the random string which was created in step 1

## Key Meanings

- EMM_EXM_EXCH_ID
    - NSE
    - BSE
    - MCX

- EMM_EXCH_SEG
    - E => Equity
    - D = > Derivatives
    - C => Currency
    - M => Commodity

- MARKET_TYPE
    - NL - Normal Market
    - MS - Morning Session
    - ES - Evening Session

- EMM_STATUS
    - CLOSE
    - OPEN
Market Depth will give you the best 5 bids and asks. If you want only the bids and asks, then you can pass ohlcvFlag = 0
